snippet: As part of an agreement with opposition parties, the premier, Nikola Gruevski, who is reeling from a wiretapping scandal, will resign by Jan.15.
abstract: Macedonian Prime Min Nikola Gruevski will step down amid wiretapping scandal; resignation will pave way for new elections in spring.

byline.original: By ALEKSANDAR DIMISHKOVSKI and RICK LYMAN
byline.contributor: Aleksandar Dimishkovski reported from Skopje, and Rick Lyman from Warsaw.

lead_paragraph: As part of an agreement with opposition parties, the premier, Nikola Gruevski, who is reeling from a wiretapping scandal, will resign by Jan.15.

headline.main: Macedonia’s Prime Minister to Resign, Paving Way for April Elections
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Macedonia: Premier to Resign by Next Year to End Standoff

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
